intro: Eschscholzia leucosticta, commonly known as the white-streaked poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its striking white and orange petals with distinct white streaks. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 3 feet and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. The species is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies.
